Reviews.Title: “Choose this hotel because of the airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: memberHolland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is getting a bit old and it is far from the citycenter and close to the metro. The metro (El Capricho) is not going directly to the airport. This hotel has got two big pros when you are travelling with a group or a family. First the rooms have a lounge with a big kitchen area without kitchen utensils. When you book a room for four persons, there is a big sofabed and another real bed in the lounge. The second pro is the reliable 24 hour airportshuttle for free. When you arrive at the airport, you first have to collect your suitcases and then you call the hotel. In our case the shuttle arrived in 10 minutes at the special hotel bus stop of the airport and went directly to the hotel ( a 5 minute ride). For guest who want to go from the hotel to the airport there is a shuttle bus every 30 minutes. This shuttle has to be reserved one day ahead. Next to the hotel are some bars and Tapas restaurants that serve rather expensive meals.

Reviews.Title: “For Price it is ok, but don't expect anything nice”
Reviews.Author: marcus232
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night and imo it was 1 night too long. At the same time it was really my fault bc I booked this hotel thinking it was closer to the city center, which it is not. Bad mistake because this hotel is right next to the airport so it is pretty far. If you are looking for a commuter hotel to the airport then it might not be bad. The room was spacious but felt dirty. The couch had these brown holes in it and was stained. The floor felt dirty too and I wound up wearing slippers all the time. The good thing is the wifi worked decently well, and the place is pretty spacious. I also only paid $58/night so it is definitely budget. Now, this place is great if you are a backpacker and want to stay in a private place with another person for the equivalent price of a hostel. Like i said before though, the hotel is far from Madrid city centre so it is not convenient for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A good, clean hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: RustyJohnsonCity_TN
Reviews.Content: I visited twice and found the hotel quiet, pleasant, clean and roomy. The staff was very helpful. I took the airport shuttle with no problems at all. There are restaurants and a park nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, WifI unusable and not enough kitchen accessiories; easy access to city centre”
Reviews.Author: NotSoDutch
Reviews.Content: + Friendly, English speaking staff. Basic but good amenities. Sports centre, airport, shopping nearby. Metro only 200 meters away, takes you direct too Madrid centre. Airport, bars/cafe, shopping, Fitness centre, metro very nearby. Quiet and nice neighbourhood. - Accessories in the kitchen could be improved though, lots of basic stuff missing. A little far away from city centre, 30 minutes by metro. Metro station is less than 200 meters from the apartment though. 2 single beds in stead of 1 double. Bathroom looked not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Free airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last summer, mainly for the free shuttle, which left whenever we needed it to, which was at 5am, the lady at the front desk helped us print out our boarding passes. The room was a bit dirty, hairs on the floor, and the fridge was not plugged in (had to call maintenance to come plug it in cause we couldn't pull it out). There is a small kitchenette and a bedroom separate from the 'living room'. Very short walk from el capricho metro station, which was about a 20 minute ride to the center. Overall it was an ok stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: GeneandJuls
Reviews.Content: I had a short night layover in Madrid and booked a double apartment for the night for 50 euros. They have a 24 hour free shuttle to and from the airport. I called them when I landed and within 5 minutes, the shuttle came to pick me up in front of the terminal. It took less than 10 minutes to drive to the hotel. In the morning, they took me to the airport at the time that I chose and dropped me at my terminal. The apartment had a closed bedroom and a living room / open plan kitchen. The living room was quite big, so was the room. Both had a large flat screen tv with a large selection of satellite channels in Spanish and English. The hotel is very well soundproofed, and even though it is right by the airport, I couldn't hear any noise. Free wifi in the room. Overall, a great airport hotel if you have a night layover.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Make Yourself at Home”
Reviews.Author: Cara S
Reviews.Content: This apartment style hotel was very comfortable and homelike. Our suite had 1 bedroom, a livingroom, kitchen and huge bathroom. The front staff were helpful and spoke English well. The long distance rates from here were unbelievable! For nearly 10 minutes to Canada was ONLY 1.10 euro! Unheard of for a hotel. They had a free shuttle to and from the airport which was very convenient. It operated 24/7. We returned our car a day early rather than contend with the time it would take to return prior to our flight. They drove us back to the hotel. Only an 8 minute drive. A couple of nice restaurants just around the corner from them too.

Reviews.Title: “great fly thru stay”
Reviews.Author: fLyBydoLL
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Madrid in transit to Valencia. Picked this hotel so we wouldn't have to shuffle thru the metro with our bags. Hotel van showed up immediately after we called for pick up. Registration took less than 5minutes. Wifi was great and our apartment was ideal size for 2 of us. Metro into Madrid was 5 minute walk then 20 minute ride. Easy and painless. Took the metro back 1am and neighborhood felt safe. Never spent enough time in the vacinity to review but the apartment itself was perfect for what we needed it for.

Reviews.Title: “Would use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: jeanette51
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night due to an Iberia airline strike , we were collected at the airport and delivered back there next morning by free transport from the hotel , we found the hotel clean and comfy , the staff was very polite and helpful and we had a good nights sleep . These are apartments and have a kitchen with a microwave but do not have any plates cups or knives and forks , pots or pans , we wanted to make a cup of coffee and the staff brought us 2 cups and a pan to boil some water in . I think value for money is very good

Reviews.Title: “Not A 4star hotel, not even classed as a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adzwee
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Madrid to watch the football and was advised through the travel agents that this hotel was excellent value for money, I think the travel agent is rubbing their hands together and laughing at my expense! The hotel needs cleaned thoroughly and brought up to date with decor from the 21st century! As for the b & b, the chef who must eat 24/7 and sweat whilst thinking about anything, I wouldnt feed it to a starving human or animal! Not recommended and would like my money back!! Best thing about the hotel was hearing the door close when leaving to come home

Reviews.Title: “Would be there again.”
Reviews.Author: 7r4v31
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 10 nights. 200 meters away from "El Capricho" metro station. Half hour from downtown Madrid by metro, line 5. Plenilunio shopping center less than 2km by feet (20 min walking time). Near the airport. Very big apartments for a very reasonable price. Helpful and polite staff. Good cleaning. Food, coffee and other beverage at very reasonable prices in machines near reception desk. Shuttle service to and from airport. Very good quality wifi internet free access. Definitely would be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms but poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: Lilly R
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for one night while in transit. The rooms are actually mini apartments and are very spacious. The carpets in the rooms are dirty and need to be thrown out, they are past being cleaned. Although this is advertised as an aparthotel and there is a microwave, stovetop and fridge, there are no plates, cups or silverware so unless you plan ahead and bring your own stuff the kitchen is no use at all. Its located in a business area though and we had some good food at a restaurant near by. All in all I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rvcarter
Reviews.Content: Very safe, clean apartment with free shuttle to airport. 100 meters from metro stop. Good wifi signal. Professional staff and free ice in the lobby!!!. High value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small apartment for the price of a room.”
Reviews.Author: Thane K
Reviews.Content: We spent our last 3 days of our 2 month stay in Spain here in Madrid. The shuttle and location to the metro made us choose this hotel. It having a separate living room and kitchen was great. They stocked the kitchen with utensils, gave us the free wifi code and we were off running around Madrid for 3 days. The metro is fairly easy to learn but keep your valuables in the in room safe(small deposit for the key) and travel just with your needed cash in a safe pocket, hopefully zipped. The pickpockets frequent the metro especially when it is packed at commute hours. The neighborhood is high density residential with stores, restaurants and a few tapas bars and feels safe to walk around. Lots of families walking with their kids. We got a winter rate of 56 euros and felt like that was a great deal. The use of their printer was free so we could print up boarding passes and other papers on the way to the airport too. Altogether it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Metro, Close to Airport, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MNwestie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aparthotel for just one night, as we had a flight departing in the morning. I was very pleased at the close proximity to the Metro station (5 minute walk to the hotel) but in a quiet, safe looking neighborhood. We took the Metro from the train station (Chamartin) to the metro station by the hotel (El Capricho), while a bit complicated, but got us there in about 50 minutes for just 1 Euro. Do your research before you go to know which Metro connections you need. The rooms were quite large, larger than a standard hotel and allowed us to have a third person easily stay in the Living area with two of us in the bedroom. The staff was very friendly and accommodating for our few requests. We took the breakfast which is at a small neighborhood bar/restaurant around the corner. While the bar was quaint and the food was OK, I should have skipped it as the kitchen had a good size refrigerator we could have kept breakfast supplies. The free shuttle service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: DitaM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Madrid Barajas airport and offer free shuttle to/from the airport. The shuttle leaves the hotel every 30minutes. The hotel has nice outdoor pool and offer free WiFi. This hotel is good for conecting passenger and regular tourist as well. The nearest metro station is less than 5 minutes wallk. The journey to the downtown takes around 30 minutes and cost around 1 EURo.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tatranka
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with free trensfer to/from the airport. It goes every half hour. I tis very close to the metro station. If you are lucky you can be in lees than half hour in the center. For lees than 1 Euro. The single trip cost 1 Euro, but if you buy 10 trip ticket, than the price is 0,74Euro per trip. The breakfas is for extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “NO F&B”
Reviews.Author: LisaC_NY
Reviews.Content: The lady at the airport travel agency recommended this as a close airport hotel which I had requested. It was fine because they had a free shuttle bus. However, this is not a hotel which you would want to stay in for layovers. The hotel is for long term stays as it comes with a kitchen (devoid of all kitchenware.) They did not have a restaurant nor min-bar, thus, no room service. They did have a menu which they called "room service" but upon reading it, it was from a local pizzeria. At the reception, they had couple of vending machines. The front desk also said there was a nearby restaurant and grocery store, but after a long day's journey and for just a layover, who wants go grocery shopping? As for the rooms, the hotel is divided into two parts, the main building and a separate building. It didn't look as if this place gets a lot of business as the building that I was placed in seemed very empty of lodgers. The room was clean enough, but one can tell that it has not been in use for some time. Next time I have to rely on the airport travel agency to help me book a hotel for the night, I'll certainly book an international chain hotel for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “4 star - you are kidding!!”
Reviews.Author: Darren1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night as it was close to the airport. The rooms were adequate but this is not a 4 star hotel or even a 3 star. The shower took 10 minutes to get hot and run brown the entire shower. The rooms were large but dated and lacked warmth. You have no option but to carry your bags up the stairs. The furniture is looking old and the beds were not comfortable for the kids. No breakfast room!! Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else, there are plenty of better options close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: knorc
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle from the airport and right next to a metro stop. We used this hotel for a 24 hour layover in Madrid. The location was perfect. It allowed us to see the major downtown Madrid sights and not worry about transportation costs or being late to the airport. The price is reasonable. There is a grocery store nearby, and it has a full kitchen. Many reasonable restaurants are within walking distance in this residential neighborhood.

HotelInfo.Name: Aparthotel Convencion Barajas
HotelInfo.Address: Noray 10-12, 28042 Madrid, Spain
